thread.title: Tuskegee extends win streak, beats Kentucky State
thread.title_full: Tuskegee extends win streak, beats Kentucky State

author: Matthew Copeland
title: Tuskegee extends win streak, beats Kentucky State
text:
Tuskegee extends win streak, beats Kentucky State Posted: FRANKFORT, KY (WSFA) - 
Tuskegee won their third straight game 38-28 over Kentucky State Saturday at Alumni Stadium in Frankfort, Kentucky. 
Tuskegee started with a flurry of scoring in the first half, giving the Golden Tigers a comfortable lead in the second half that they held throughout the game. 
Tuskegee started the scoring on their first drive of the game. 
After driving to the Kentucky State five-yard line, Tyree Brooks finished off the 9-play drive with a touchdown run to give the Golden Tigers an early 7-0 lead. 
Late in the quarter, Tuskegee struck again with one of their two big plays from scrimmage of the game. Running back Kenno Loyal broke free for a 73-yard touchdown run, extending Tuskegee's lead to 14. 
Kentucky State scored on their first drive of the second quarter with a 21-yard pass from Ora Johnson to Charles Johnson. 
The Thorobreds got the ball back following a fumble by quarterback Kevin Lacey. Four plays later, Ora Johnson connected with Lavelle Cloyd for a 6-yard touchdown to briefly knot the game at 14. 
On the ensuing drive, Tuskegee's Dennis Norfleet sprang for a 74-yard touchdown run to give the Golden Tigers the lead back. 
After forcing Kentucky State to punt, the Golden Tigers struck again with a 9-yard touchdown run from Kenno Loyal. 
Tuskegee took a 28-14 lead going into halftime. 
Tuskegee added a field goal in their first possession of the half to extend the lead to 17. 
On the ensuing drive, Kentucky State drove 64 yards in eleven plays for a touchdown to bring the Thorobreds back within two scores. 
The score remained 31-21 going into the final quarter. 
With less than 10 minutes to go, Kentucky State lined up for a field goal to cut the score to seven. The kick was blocked and recovered by Micheal Robinson. Robinson sprang free for a touchdown on the blocked kick, giving the Golden Tigers a commanding 38-21 lead midway through the final quarter. 
However, Kentucky State would get their revenge for the big return. Late in the quarter, Kentucky State blocked a punt by Tuskegee. Thorobred Moronkie Tapper recovered the kick and returned it to the endzone for a touchdown. 
Kentucky State failed to recover the onside kick, sealing Tuskegee's 38-28 victory. 
Running back Kenno Loyal led the Golden Tigers offensively. He picked up 113 yards on nine rushes with two touchdowns. 
The Golden Tigers forced two turnovers defensively, and held the Thorobreds to under 300 yards total. 
Tuskegee improves to 7-1 on the season. They remain on top of the SIAC's West Division at 3-0. Next week, Tuskegee returns home to face Central State. Kickoff is at 1:00 p.m.
